titleInfo.title: Photoionization of an open-shell atom with open-shell final ionic state: A spin-resolved study of photoelectrons above the Tl+ (6s6p) P-3(1) limit

mods.abstract: Spin-resolved measurements of the dynamic photoionization parameters for photoelectrons from thallium atoms are presented for the Tl+ (5d(10)6s6p) P-3(1) final ionic state in the complex spectral region from 90 to 77 nm. For a complete description of this ionization process more than three transition matrix elements are needed since neither the initial nor the final state has closed-shell configuration. An approximate determination of matrix elements and phase shift differences is carried out. In addition, it is discussed how complete information may in principle be obtained.

titleInfo.title: JOURNAL OF ELECTRON SPECTROSCOPY AND RELATED PHENOMENA
